data.title: European Central Bank
data.meta_description: The European Central Bank (ECB) is the central bank of the European Union countries which have adopted the euro. Our main task is to maintain price stability in the euro area and so preserve the purchasing power of the single currency.
data.text:
PRESS RELEASE

ECB harmonises collateral management rules

We have harmonised the rules for collateral management in Eurosystem credit operations, marking a further step towards capital markets union. The rules will come into effect with the launch of the Eurosystem Collateral Management System, scheduled for 18 November 2024.

Read the press release

EVENT

Europa Open Air is back!

Together with broadcaster Hessischer Rundfunk, we’re thrilled to announce that this year’s Europa Open Air concert will take place on 22 August. The Frankfurt Radio Symphony will perform timeless orchestral pieces at Weseler Werft, in our home town of Frankfurt.

Read the press release

PODCAST

The ECB Podcast Summer School #1

What is European banking supervision and how is it connected to our bank accounts? And what does football have to do with it? Our host Stefania Secola discusses these questions and more with Supervisory Board member Elizabeth McCaul in part one of our Summer School.

Listen to The ECB Podcast
